Content.Knowledge Point: Camera Setup for Top-Down Cooking Videos
Content.Text: Use a C-stand with a removable tripod head for a stable top-down shot. Traditional tripods may not provide the desired angle. Check the article below for alternative setups.
Use a large softbox for diffused lighting to avoid harsh shadows. You can also use a homemade setup with a lamp and wax paper for diffused light.

Content.Knowledge Point: Set Dressing for Top-Down Cooking Videos
Content.Text: Ensure a clean and appealing cooking surface with good coverage, close-ups, informational text, and cross-sections. This enhances viewer engagement.

Content.Knowledge Point: Applying the Top-Down Technique to Other Video Types
Content.Text: The top-down technique can be used for instructional builds and product showcases, not just food videos. It boosts social media engagement.
